metadata.title: TPO & Solar Finance Providers - Texas 2026
metadata.description: Third-Party Ownership solar providers and finance companies active in Texas, post-residential ITC expiration

regulatory_context.commercial_itc_48E: ACTIVE - 30% baseline for TPO providers through end of 2027 (construction must begin by July 4, 2026)
regulatory_context.impact: TPO (lease/PPA) is now the ONLY way for residential customers to access federal tax credits
regulatory_context.market_shift: TPO projected to grow 25% in 2026 vs 2025; already ~45% of US residential installs
regulatory_context.residential_installations_decline: 18% YoY decline expected in 2026 due to ITC expiration for owned systems

texas_market_context.net_metering: Not mandated statewide; Retail Electric Providers (REPs) offer solar buyback programs
texas_market_context.state_rebates: Varies by utility - Austin Energy, CPS Energy, Oncor have programs

ppa.name: Sunrun PPA
ppa.description: Pay per kWh of solar electricity generated

rate_range_cents_kwh.notes: Varies by market, system size, credit profile

ppa.performance_guarantee_detail: Refund for shortfall if system underproduces promised output

lease.name: Sunrun Monthly Solar Lease / Subscription
lease.description: Fixed monthly payment for solar system use

loan.name: Sunrun Owned Plans
loan.description: Purchase via loan or cash through Sunrun

prepaid_ppa.name: Sunrun Prepaid
prepaid_ppa.description: Upfront payment at ~70% of system cost; ownership transfer after 6 years
prepaid_ppa.notes: Homeowner benefits from 48E tax credit value passed through as discount

buyout_options.buyout_price_method: Fair Market Value (FMV) assessed by 3rd party appraiser
buyout_options.warnings: Consumer complaints suggest FMV estimates may be inflated vs expectations set during sales

credit_requirements.notes: Sunrun advertises flexible credit options; some sources say no hard credit check for leases

dealer_program.name: Sunrun Certified Partner Program
dealer_program.description: Tiered channel partner network with differentiated value levels
benefits: Access to Sunrun BrightPath automated project platform
Preferred pricing through equipment suppliers (AEE Solar, SnapNrack)
dealer_program.commission_structure: Not publicly disclosed; varies by tier and volume
dealer_program.notes: Sunrun works with local installation companies who sell Sunrun lease/PPA products

tpo_providers.name: Sunnova / Solaris Assets (SunStrong)
tpo_providers.texas_active: UNCERTAIN - Legacy systems being serviced; new installations status unclear

bankruptcy_timeline.court: US Bankruptcy Court, Southern District of Texas

new_ownership.omnidian_purchase: Sunnova's solar servicing platform sold to Omnidian for $7 million

ppa.service_plan: Sunnova Protect Platinum - 25 years maintenance, monitoring, repairs, replacements, energy guarantee

dealer_program.name: Sunnova Catalyst (legacy)
dealer_program.current_status: UNCERTAIN post-bankruptcy; contact SunStrong for current programs
dealer_program.previous_dealer_network_size: Large national network, particularly strong in Texas

tpo_providers.notes: Sunnova was headquartered in Houston and was a major Texas TPO player. Post-bankruptcy under Solaris/SunStrong, the focus appears to be on servicing existing customer portfolios rather than new originations. Platform may be rebuilt under new ownership.

tpo_providers.name: Tesla Energy

lease.name: Tesla Solar Lease
lease.description: Fixed monthly payment with 3% annual escalator
lease.maintenance_detail: All maintenance, service and monitoring for full lease term including battery and inverter replacement

subscription.available_in_texas: CHECK - Tesla financing confirmed for TX but subscription availability varies
subscription.name: Tesla Solar Subscription
subscription.description: Flat monthly rate for solar + storage, no long-term commitment

buyout_options.buyout_price_method: Fair Market Value outlined in contract

system_requirements.panels: Tesla Solar Panels or Solar Roof

tpo_providers.dealer_program_notes: Tesla does NOT operate a dealer program. Direct-to-consumer only. Cannot partner as a dealer.

tpo_providers.name: Palmetto Solar (LightReach)
tpo_providers.texas_availability_notes: Varies by utility provider. Most Texas utilities support PPAs. Some co-ops offer leasing. Austin Energy and CPS Energy (San Antonio) may have restrictions on TPO.

ppa.name: LightReach PPA
ppa.description: Pay per kWh produced; rate varies with production (higher in summer)
ppa.escalator_notes: Sales rep selects escalator during pricing phase

lease.name: LightReach Lease
lease.description: Fixed monthly payment regardless of production

dealer_program.name: Palmetto Partner Program
dealer_program.tools: LightReach quoting and proposal tools for dealers

tpo_providers.name: EnFin (by Qcells)
tpo_providers.market_position: Major emerging TPO platform; part of the ~45% TPO market share alongside Sunrun, Palmetto, GoodLeap

dealer_program.name: EnFin Partner Program
dealer_program.how_to_become_partner: Register through EnFin website or Aurora Solar integration
dealer_program.notes: Only current EnFin partners can activate Aurora integration

tpo_providers.equipment_notes: Strong alignment with Qcells panels (FEOC compliant, US-manufactured in Dalton, GA)
tpo_providers.competitive_advantage: Qcells panels manufactured in the US, making them FEOC-compliant and 48E eligible

tpo_providers.name: Momentum Solar
tpo_providers.texas_markets: Texas is in their 12-state service area

ppa.description: Fixed rate per kWh with project manager handling design, permitting, financing, installation

lease.description: Rent panels with maintenance, repair, and monitoring included

system_requirements.battery_available: Only in 5 states (check if Texas is included)

dealer_program.notes: Not a major dealer/channel partner platform; primarily direct sales

tpo_providers.name: Freedom Solar Power

lease.notes: Offers solar leases; likely through TPO financing partners

tpo_providers.tpo_notes: Freedom Solar is primarily an installer. For TPO products (lease/PPA), they likely partner with finance providers like Sunrun, Palmetto LightReach, or EnFin rather than originating their own TPO products.

timeline.assets_acquired_by: Complete Solar (Blue Raven Solar + New Homes business)

existing_contracts.notes: Existing lease/PPA contracts remain in effect and must be honored by successor entities

existing_contracts.warranty_status: 25-year workmanship warranty and power production guarantee claimed to remain in effect
existing_contracts.practical_reality: Fulfilling long-term labor obligations without dedicated service team is extremely difficult
existing_contracts.notes: Lenders have pressured ADT back into limited solar operations to protect outstanding loan portfolios

defunct_tpo_providers.name: Vivint Solar (now under Sunrun)
defunct_tpo_providers.notes: Integration issues led to widespread customer dissatisfaction. Sunrun facing class action allegations of misleading PPA sales tactics.

solar_loan_providers.name: GoodLeap

standard_installment.notes: Advertised APR as low as 1.99%; typical range 5-9% with dealer fees included

flexpay.description: Choose payment amount; interest-only period of 18, 36, or 60 months

dealer_fees.impact: A $20,000 install with 35% dealer fee becomes a $27,000 loan principal
dealer_fees.controversy: Minnesota AG lawsuit alleging inflated costs through hidden dealer fees

credit_requirements.notes: Credit score impacts APR, dealer fee percentage, and borrowing limit

solar_loan_providers.tpo_relevance: GoodLeap also entering TPO space as a PPA/lease finance platform
solar_loan_providers.legal_issues: Minnesota AG lawsuit (2024) over dealer fee disclosure practices

solar_loan_providers.name: Mosaic

solar_loan.promotional_rates: As low as 0.99% for qualified borrowers

dealer_fees.structure: Percentage of loan balance; varies by loan and risk characteristics
dealer_fees.controversy: Part of Minnesota AG lawsuit over dealer fee disclosure

solar_loan_providers.notes: Existing loan customers continue making payments as normal. New loan originations continue during Chapter 11.

solar_loan_providers.name: Dividend Finance
solar_loan_providers.status: ACTIVE - Being acquired by Fifth Third Bancorp

acquisition.purpose: Upgrade renewables portfolio and ESG commitment

dealer_fees.controversy: Part of Minnesota AG lawsuit over dealer fee disclosure

solar_loan_providers.name: Sunlight Financial
solar_loan_providers.notes: Loans continue to be originated through Cross River Bank partnership. Company struggled due to delayed response to rising interest rates.
solar_loan_providers.legal_issues: Part of Minnesota AG lawsuit over dealer fee disclosure

average_ppa_rate_texas.comparison: PPA rates typically 10-30% below local utility rate

average_lease_payment.notes: Varies widely by system size; Tesla range $65-$195/month for subscription; other providers similar

financing_breakdown_estimate.notes: ESTIMATE based on national trends. TPO share rising rapidly post-ITC expiration. Pre-2026 breakdown was approximately 35% TPO, 45% loan, 20% cash.

prepaid_ppa_trend.description: Emerging model: pay ~70% of system cost upfront, take ownership after 6 years
prepaid_ppa_trend.benefits: Access to 48E tax credit value as discount + eventual ownership
irs_requirements: Business must hold property for at least 5 years
Buyout options must approximate fair market value
Title transfers must not be automatic
Term must be shorter than expected useful life
Service provider must bear benefits and burden of ownership (production guarantee required)
prepaid_ppa_trend.potential_credit_value_percent: Up to 50% of project cost (30% base + bonus adders)
prepaid_ppa_trend.feoc_restriction: System must use FEOC-compliant equipment since TPO owner claims 48E credit

key_market_drivers: 25D residential ITC expired Jan 1, 2026 - homeowners cannot claim tax credit on owned systems
48E commercial ITC available to TPO providers through end of 2027
Construction must begin by July 4, 2026 for 48E eligibility
FEOC compliance required: 40% domestic content in 2026
Major TPO competitors (Sunnova, SunPower, ADT Solar) exited market via bankruptcy
Sunrun is now dominant TPO player with reduced competition
New entrants like EnFin (Qcells) filling the gap
Prepaid PPA / lease-to-own models emerging as hybrid option
Solar loan sector also distressed (Mosaic Chapter 11, Sunlight restructured)
Dealer fee controversy and lawsuits creating regulatory pressure on loan providers

tier_1_active_tpo.strength: Market leader, full Texas coverage, strong dealer network, public company financial stability
tier_1_active_tpo.weakness: 3.5% escalator is highest in industry; FMV buyout complaints

tier_1_active_tpo.strength: Brand power, Powerwall integration, Austin HQ, 3% escalator, strong performance guarantee
tier_1_active_tpo.weakness: No dealer program (direct only), limited flexibility, Powerwall bundling

tier_1_active_tpo.strength: Flexible escalator options (0-2.99%), strong dealer platform via Enerflo
tier_1_active_tpo.weakness: Availability varies by Texas utility; restrictions in Austin Energy and CPS Energy areas

tier_1_active_tpo.strength: Qcells US-manufactured panels (FEOC compliant), strong ABS financing, Aurora integration

tier_2_active_but_limited.weakness: NJ-based, limited Texas market depth, battery only in 5 states

tier_2_active_but_limited.strength: Texas-based (Austin), 24K+ installs, SunPower Master Dealer, Tesla Powerwall certified
tier_2_active_but_limited.weakness: Primarily an installer, not a TPO originator; relies on third-party finance partners

exited_or_restructured: SunPower - Bankrupt Aug 2024, no new TPO
Sunnova - Bankrupt Jun 2025, acquired by Solaris/SunStrong, new originations unclear
Vivint Solar - Absorbed into Sunrun 2020, brand defunct
competitive_landscape_summary.recommendation_for_solar_platform: Partner with Sunrun (largest TPO, Texas coverage), Palmetto LightReach (flexible terms, dealer-friendly), and EnFin (Qcells-backed, FEOC compliant). Tesla is direct-only so cannot partner as dealer. For loans, GoodLeap is most stable option despite dealer fee controversy.
